alfredsnippet.snippet:
"In practice scientific debate does not seem like a real search for truth. Rather it seems like a multiplayer game in which there are formal rules but rules that are never enforced. In science, no referee ever blows his whistle and, as a result, many players just seek to win by any means, fair or foul."

- John Hewitt, The Architecture of Thought
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Scientific Debate is Not Like a Real Search for Truth
